titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Association of Fundraising Professionals Records, Western Pennsylvania Chapter, 1980-2005 AIS.2003.10
titlestmt.author: Peter Bess.

did.unittitle: Association of Fundraising Professionals, Western Pennsylvania Chapter, Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Association of Fundraising Professionals. Western Pennsylvania Chapter

did.abstract: The Association of Fundraising Professionals, Western Pennsylvania Chapter was established in 1980. They are one of 200 chapters worldwide. The chapter is made up of members from western Pennsylvania, eastern Ohio, West Virginia, and western Maryland. Their papers highlight the work they have done since 1980 to promote the goals of the Association of Fundraising Professionals, which is to "advance philanthropy through advocacy, research, education and certification programs."

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Association of Fundraising Professionals, formerly known as the National Society of Fund Raising Executives (NSFRE), was founded in 1960 to be a leader in the philanthropy world. Its goals are to promote stewardship, donor trust, and effective and ethical fundraising. Twenty years later, in 1980, eighteen members founded the Association of Fundraising Professionals, Western Pennsylvania Chapter (AFP-WPA).

The Western Pennsylvania Chapter was born out of necessity. There were a number of members who did not have a locally affiliated chapter. B. Jeanne Williams called for a gathering of NSFRE members and interested parties to establish a chapter in Western PA. After two meetings, they all agreed to start a chapter.

AFP-WPA's charter was accepted on September 5, 1980 and six days later on September 11 they held their first official meeting. At the time of its inception, Jeanne Williams was the acting chairman of the chapter. Thirty-six people were in attendance as J. Richard Wilson, Executive Vice President of NSFRE, gave his predictions for the future of the new chapter. By December of the same year, Warren Dana was elected the first President of AFP-WPA.

At the beginning of 1981, AFP-WPA had already begun putting together a newsletter to act as evidence of their progress. Their chapter by-laws had been approved, and they had sent a representative, Jeanne Williams, to the national meeting to represent their chapter.

By 1982 the chapter was running full-force, holding meetings each month, planning seminars for training and membership growth, holding luncheons, and continuing to release its newsletter to members so that everyone was kept up-to-date within the chapter.

Since these beginning years, AFP-WPA has continued to grow; its membership has risen to more than 400 fundraising professionals. They actively participate in the National Philanthropy Day, which was started by AFP in 1986. Also, they continue to attend the international conferences sponsored by AFP and held around the country. The chapter has been commended multiple times by the local government for its participation in fundraising initiatives. In 2005 Mayor Tom Murphy of Pittsburgh announced that November 15 would be "National Philanthropy Day" in Pittsburgh. This announcement was accompanied by many like it from government officials in Allegheny County and Washington County. Also a "Fund Raising Day" was proclaimed by Allegheny County in April 1998.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The records from AFP-WPA highlight the activity of the chapter from the point of its inception in 1980 to 2005. The meeting minutes of the chapter ranging from 1980 through 1999 show the focus of the chapter as it has evolved and grown over the years. There are also the collected newsletters of the local chapter and the national foundation chronicling the activities of both. Brochures and paperwork for National Philanthropy Day and Fund Raising Day provide a look into two of the major days of the chapter's programming year.
The majority of the records in this collection pertain to the 1990s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The contents of the collection are organized into seven series:
Series V. NSFRE Conference and National Assembly Materials
Series VI. Chapter and National Publications

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Association of Fundraising Professionals, Western Pennsylvania Chapter in October 2003.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note
phystech.p: Within the collection are two floppy discs, two 7 Â½ ips audio reels, and one U-matic videotape; each of these requires special hardware to play.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Association of Fundraising Professionals Records, Western Pennsylvania Chapter, 1980-2005, AIS.2003.10, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Association of Fundraising Professionals Records, Western Pennsylvania Chapter, 1980-2005, AIS.2003.10, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Peter Bess in January - February 2009.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Permission for publication is given on behalf of the University of Pittsburgh as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: The AFP/Wiley Fund Development Series, published by Wiley, is an ongoing book series devoted to fundraising, non-profit, and philanthropic issues. A few of these books can be found through PittCat+ on the University of Pittsburgh's Library website.

National Society of Fund Raising Executives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: These files contain the minutes of board meetings, annual meetings, and some committee meetings. They act as evidence of the Chapter's activities and membership. The material in this series dates from 1980 to 1999; however the majority of the material dates from 1995 to 1999.

did.unittitle: PA State Issues Task Force Meeting
Memberships Election of Nominating Committee Members

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: These are the files of the President of AFP-WPA through the years 1985 to 2005. The files contain information on the chapter (by-laws, public relations, financial statements, etc.), projects, and individual members. The material in this series dates from 1985 to 2005; however the majority of the material dates from 1991 to 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: These are the files pertaining to National Philanthropy Day. The files are arranged chronologically starting with National Philanthropy Day 1987. It is celebrated each year in November. Also present in the files are government proclamations from counties around the Pittsburgh area formally recognizing National Philanthropy Day.

did.unittitle: Butler County, PA recognizes National Philanthropy Day
Westmoreland County, PA recognizes National Philanthropy Day
Fayette County, PA recognizes National Philanthropy Day
City of Pittsburgh, PA recognizes National Philanthropy Day
City of Pittsburgh, PA recognizes National Philanthropy Day
Allegheny County, PA recognizes National Philanthropy Day
Washington County, PA recognizes National Philanthropy Day

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: These are the files pertaining to Fund Raising Day. Fund Raising Day is another day like National Philanthropy Day. It is held each year and includes meetings and conferences. These files are arranged chronologically starting with Fundraising Day 1990. Also present is one county government recognition of Fund Raising Day.

did.unittitle: Allegheny County, PA recognizes Fund Raising Day
NSFRE Conference and National Assembly Materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: These files contain brochures for the International Conference on Fund Raising and papers pertaining to the National Assemblies of the NSFRE. Also included in some files are papers regarding chapter scholarships for individuals to attend the International Conference.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: These files contain the NSFRE International Newsletters and the NSFRE - WPA Newsletters. In 2001 the name of the organization changed from the National Association of Fund Raising Executives to the Association of Fundraising Professionals. This is evidenced by the changing of the newsletter title in 2001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: These files contain photos from different foundational meetings, such as National Philanthropy Day and Fund Raising Day. Also, there are two 7 Â½ ips that contain public service announcements for National Philanthropy Day 1990 and 1991. There is one U-matic video-tape that contains two public service announcements for National Philanthropy Day 1991.
